meanings.definition: Ammunition: bullets, shells, or other projectiles used in firearms.
meanings.sent1: The soldier loaded his gun with ammo before heading into battle.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to always have enough ammo when going hunting.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper accidentally dropped a box of ammo, causing a loud clatter.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like powerful ammo, piercing through his defenses.
meanings.sent5: The shiny bullets in the ammo box gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Ammunition: material fired, scattered, dropped, or detonated from any weapon, as bombs or rockets, and especially shot, shrapnel, bullets, or shells.
meanings.sent1: The military stockpiled large amounts of ammo for the upcoming operation.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display included colorful bursts of ammo lighting up the sky.
meanings.sent3: The kids had a playful snowball fight, using snowballs as their ammo.
meanings.sent4: His jokes were his verbal ammo, always making people laugh.
meanings.sent5: The artillery fired its deadly ammo towards the enemy lines.
